reasoning: This describes the main problem or task addressed in the text.
This is a broader context for the problem, a key area of application.
This is the specific task or problem addressed in the text.
This describes a key resource or input in the problem, unique identifiers for objects.
This refers to the data used in the problem, which may be noisy or uncertain.
This is a specific type of noise or uncertainty in the data, corruption of author information.
This is another specific type of noise or uncertainty in the data, corruption of title information.
This is a specific approach or method used to model the data, a probabilistic grammar for citations.
This is a specific algorithm used for inference, a type of Markov chain Monte Carlo.
This refers to a specific technique used to improve the efficiency of the inference process.
This refers to the specific types of data or features that the method can determine, such as author names.
This describes the overall approach or philosophy of the method, a declarative and relational model.
